abstract.original_text: Pneumonia is a common illness with estimates of approximately 450 million cases per year. According to the World Health Organization, lower respiratory tract infections account for approximately 7% of deaths per year worldwide. 1 Viruses are a common cause of community-acquired pneumonia, particularly among children. Among pediatric community-acquired pneumonia studies, where viral causes were specifically sought, the incidence of viral etiology of infection was 49%.
